subQuestions.title: Do you like to preserve memories by photo or writing?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Absolutely, I have a profound admiration for photography. It's fascinating to me how we can freeze moments in time and preserve them. As a tradition in my family, we highly value memories and bonds with our loved ones, and photographs serve as a tangible reminder of those connections. They're not just pictures to me; they're memories, stories, and emotions captures in a single frame.

subQuestions.title: Why do people today like to use photos to save memories?

I have to say that there are many reasons that people today like to use photos to save memories.

content.questionName: Speaking - Gặp thế hệ già, trẻ hơn - Part 2

subQuestions.title: Compare 2 pictures
subQuestions.suggestion:
• In the first picture, I can see two women going shopping together. They might be mother and daughter since the woman on the right looks much older than the one on the left. The daughter looks so beautiful with long black hair and a pink dress. The mother looks elegent with a black dress. They both look so fashionable and well dressed. They are standing at a store selling watches and trying on some models before buying them. Behind the two women, I can see a glass showcase and inside it were many beautiful watches. They look so happy and seem to enjoy their time spent together very much.
  • In the right picture, there are two women buying clothes from a stall in a market. They are both wearing casual clothes and choosing clothes from a coat-hanger. On the coat-hanger, there are many dresses with diverse patterns, like flowers or dots, and models so that customers can be spoilt with choice. They look so happy choosing their new dresses. I like this picture because I also buy my clothes from the market since they are affordable and not over-priced and there are many trendy models there.

subQuestions.title: What is different about these two shopping experiences ?
Why are people people are attracted to expensive by expensive things ?
subQuestions.suggestion: • People's desire for expensive things can stem from a variety of reasons. These may include social status, the belief that expensive items are of higher quality, or a desire for luxury and comfort. Additionally, some individuals may use expensive items as a way to express their personal style or as a form of self-expression, or some may have a hobby to collect items from luxury brands like purses, high heels or makeup items.

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture
subQuestions.suggestion: • In the picture, I can see four people working in an office. There are three women and a woman, to be more specific. They are all wearing casual clothes and sitting around a wooden table, on which there are office documents, laptops and a computer. Everyone is working on their laptops and computer attentively and productively. The room looks spacious with a white wall hung with beautiful pictures and a big window overlooking the street. I like this picture because it shows perfectly the working environment of an office worker on a daily basis.

subQuestions.title: Tell me about a time when you did some work.
subQuestions.suggestion: • During my student life, I participated in numerous teamwork projects, and having disagreements with other team members was unavoidable. I would like to talk about a team project that I was involved in during the junior year at university. There were two of us on the team, and our task was to invest in the simulation stock market. Each group’s performance would be compared weekly, and at the end of the semester, we would have to present our project in front of the whole class. Despite our arguments, we completed the task on time and had an excellent group presentation. From this experience, I learned that it is very hard to be a good team member. You would have to know how to present yourself while fitting in the group and each person has to compromise to achieve a common goal.

subQuestions.title: Why is it important for people to enjoy their work?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Yes, it is extremely important to love what you do since liking your job will help you succeed. Being happy at work and loving what you do is an overall productivity booster and enhances performance. People who enjoy their jobs are more likely to be optimistic, motivated, learn faster, and make better business decisions.In contrast, unhappiness can cause stress, lower your immune system, and have a range of psychological effects such as prolonged depression and anxiety.

subQuestions.title: Tell me what you see in the two photographs.
subQuestions.suggestion:
• In the first picture, I can see many people who are lying and playing on a beach. They look so comfortable in swimming clothes. The picture on the left shows the sea in the background. The space is very crowded and the weather is very hot. I am impressed by the first one/ second one because it reminds me of some wonderful memories.
  • In the second picture, there is a family of three people, including a man, a woman and a child. They are picnicking, sitting on green grass and laughing happily together with food in front of them. They look comfortable in casual clothes. Behind them, there are many trees and a tent.

subQuestions.title: Which one do you prefer: eating out or eating at home?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Personally, I prefer eating at home because it's  healthier, cheaper, and I can have more control over ingredients and portion sizes. Additionally, eating at home provides a comfortable and personalized dining environment, often fostering family bonding and relaxation. Also, eating out is often more expensive and unhygienic.

subQuestions.title: Why do people prefer eating out to eating at home?
subQuestions.suggestion: • People prefer eating out to eating at home for many reasons. Firstly, it is more convenient and time-saving because they don’t have to spend time preparing ingredients, cooking and cleaning up afterward. Also, it provides an opportunity to try new and diverse cuisines, and allows people to socialize and experience different settings

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture.
subQuestions.suggestion: • In the picture, I can see two people who are decorating their house. I guess they are a couple, including a man and a woman. They look professional in formal clothes. The woman has short hair and is wearing a grey pijama, while the man is wearing a red shirt and beige pants. Plus, they seem to be very concentrated as the man is hanging a picture on the wall. I think they are in a living room. The space is quite large. In the picture, I can see many picture frames on the floor and on the wall. I love this picture at first sight because it reminds me of some wonderful moments with my family.

subQuestions.title: Tell me about a time you decorated your house.
subQuestions.suggestion: • Last fall, I decided to decorate my house for Halloween. I hung up spooky spider webs on the porch and placed carved pumpkins with candles inside them by the front steps. Inside, I put up paper bats on the walls and arranged colorful autumn leaves on the dining table. The house felt festive and ready for trick-or-treaters. That night, as kids came by in their costumes, their smiles made all the effort worth it.

subQuestions.title: In modern life, people pay more attention to home decoration than in the past. Do you agree?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Yes, I agree that in modern life, people tend to pay more attention to home decoration than in the past. Because with the rise of social media platforms like Instagram, Pinterest, and YouTube, people have more access to home decor ideas and trends. This exposure inspires them to decorate their living spaces. Also, people view their homes as an expression of their personalities and like to decorate them in ways that reflect their tastes and lifestyles.

subQuestions.title: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestions.suggestion:
• In the first picture, there is a family of four people shopping at a supermarket including: a father, a mother, a daughter and a son. The father is wearing a green shirt, while the mother is wearing a checkered shirt. She looks outstanding with her brown curly hair, which is beautiful. The father is colling his wife, and the siblings are standing next to each other, smiling happily. They are pulling a shopping cart filled with bread, bananas, pineapples,.... On both sides of the picture, I can see two aisles of groceries that look colorful.
  • In the second picture, I can see a woman selling boxes of strawberries behind the stall. She looks so beautiful with blonde hair and is wearing a checkered shirt. She is smiling happily and friendly. On the counter, there are boxes of strawberries. They all look so good and I also love having strawberries as my dessert. Behind her, there is a curtain with a strawberry pattern, which looks so adorable and well painted. She may be at a local fair.

subQuestions.title: Benefits of markets and supermarkets ?
subQuestions.suggestion: • I think both have different strengths but contribute to a common purpose. The public market is important in a community as it facilitates social connection and provides amenities that encourage people to get closer. It is also more accessible in rural areas. In supermarkets, there is always a discount on products. Also, in supermarkets, it is still possible to find fresh and quality products. There is a playground for kids and a car park zone, so you don't need to worry about your kids and your car.

subQuestions.title: Why do many people not like shopping ?
subQuestions.suggestion: There are several reasons why some people may not enjoy shopping. For some, it could be due to a dislike of crowded spaces, long lines, or the stress of making decisions. Others may find shopping overwhelming or time-consuming. Additionally, some people may have financial concerns or simply prefer to spend their time on other activities.

subQuestions.title: Describe this picture.
subQuestions.suggestion: In the picture, there are seven people in an office room. They are all office workers of a company. The six people sitting around the table may be employees, while the man standing is the boss. Those four women are all wearing blue or white shirts, while the two other men are wearing polite suits. On the table, there are many laptops and tablets, as well as cups of coffee or water. The boss may be bringing up plans or ideas for the next campaigns of the company during the meeting, while his employees are listening intentively. The office looks nice, with glass doors, a window and a white board or maybe a projector.

subQuestions.title: Tell us about the time you give a presentation. How did you feel?
subQuestions.suggestion: When I got into high school, we were given a presentation as our homework. It was the first time I had a presentation, so I was so nervous talking to a classroom of people about a topic that should interest people. My teacher let the class do a presentation on absolutely anything they wanted. I first chose to present about Animal Assisted Therapy. In the end, the class liked my presentation and I felt proud of myself. My teacher even used my PowerPoint as an example for his other classes. For someone who hates public speaking, this was a memorable experience with a presentation for me.

subQuestions.title: Why are people scared of public speaking ?
subQuestions.suggestion: The most common reason why people are scared when it comes to presenting or speaking in public is the fear of failing or self-doubt. Also, people get nervous when speaking in public because of the fear of being judged or making mistakes. All of these factors can cause our body to react in various ways, including increased heart rate, a dry mouth, and trembling.

subQuestions.title: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestions.suggestion:
Giống: Both pictures show me about sports. 

Khác: The differences between the two pictures are:

In the first picture, I can see 4 people. They are sitting in wheelchairs. They are playing basketball. They are wearing blue and black T-shirts. I see many people in basketball court (sân bóng rổ).

But in the second picture, I can see 4 people: 2 men and 2 women. They are shaking hands (bắt tay). They are in outdoor tennis court (sân tennis ngoài trời). I also see a coconut tree. 

Thích tranh nào hơn:  I prefer picture 1 because I like basketball.

subQuestions.title: Benifits of indoor and outdoor sports?
subQuestions.suggestion:
Both indoor and outdoor sports have benefits.  

Indoor sports seem to be safer (an toàn hơn) than outdoor sports. People can play games all the time regardless of (bất chấp)/ in bad weather (con người có thể chơi thể thao mọi lúc bất chấp thời tiết xấu). For example, playing football under the hard sunshine can make people ill. Rain can stop people from playing games outdoor. 

Outdoor sports make people closer to nature (gần gũi với thiên nhiên hơn). Playing voleyball at the beach or playing basketball in the outdoor court are very interesting.

subQuestions.title: Playing a game is to win. What do you think ?
subQuestions.suggestion:
I don’t completely agree with this opinion. In a way, playing a game is to win but sometimes people play games for relaxing. It helps reduce stress after a tiring day. Playing games also helps people get to know each other better.

CHƯA HẾT THỜI GIAN: Chúng ta có thể kể về trải nghiệm của bản thân.

Ex: I am a 25 years old man. I am single. I like football very much. On weekends, my friends and I always go to the football court to play football. My team has 7 people: Long, Quang, Huy, Tien,… They are handsome. They are single. They can cook very well…

content.questionName: Speaking - Công viên giải trí - Part 3

subQuestions.title: Describe this picture?
subQuestions.suggestion:
In the picture, I can see many people (số lượng): men, women, the old (người già) and children. They are walking on the street (đang đi bộ trên đường). After them, I see a lot of tall buildings. 

This picture reminds me of my family. Every day, my parents and I get up at 6 a.m…(tiếp một ngày của mình).

subQuestions.title: A time when you were in a crowded place
subQuestions.suggestion:
(dùng hoàn toàn thì hiện tại đơn ok nhé).

A time when I were in a crowded place was/is 1 month ago. It is a concert near Hoan Kiem Lake . There are so many people here (có quá nhiều người ở đây). I go there with my friends: Nam, Huy, Ngoc,… 

Để kéo dài thời gian ở đây chúng ta có 2 cách:

Cách 1: Kể về các friends của mình.

Nam is the oldest (Nam là người lớn tuổi nhất). He is 27 years old. He is handsome… (lần lượt mô tả những người bạn của mình cho đến khi hết thời gian).

Cách 2: Kể về một ngày của mình.

On that day, I get up at 6 a.m. I do morning exercises until 7 a.m. After that, I have breakfast at 8 a.m. At 9 a.m, I drive a car to work. At 11 a.m, I have lunch with my friends/ colleagues (đồng nghiệp). At 1 p.m, I come back to the office for work (tôi quay lại văn phòng để làm việc). I work until 5 p.m. I go to the gym. At 7 p.m, I come back home. At 8 p.m, I have a date with my girlfriend. We have dinner together and go to see a movie. At 11 p.m, I go to bed.

subQuestions.title: Why people not like crowded places ?
subQuestions.suggestion:
There are many reasons (câu muôn thuở khi được hỏi Why) why people don’t like crowed places. 

People do not like crowded places because of many reasons. 

First, I think they don’t like crowed places because of their privacy (sự riêng tư). Some introverted people don’t like going to the places where they can meet their relations (một số người hướng nội không thích đến những nơi mà họ có thể gặp những người quen của họ). 

Second, after Covid-19 , people tend to avoid going to crowded places. (sau dịch covid 19, con người có xu hướng tránh đến những nơi đông người). 

Third, recently (gần đây), crowded places can cause accidents (Iteawon).

subQuestions.title: Where would you rather live?

subQuestions.title: Why do people like to decorate their home?
subQuestions.suggestion: I believe it is because decorating rooms creates a sense of joy, motivating people to start their day and makes them feel like staying at home.

content.questionName: Speaking - Thứ mà bạn muốn nhưng không có được - Part 3

subQuestions.title: Describe this picture?
subQuestions.suggestion: Looking at this picture, I can see a group of people going hiking together. They all wear jackets and wool hats with backpacks behind. They also hold trekking poles. The man standing in the left corner is wearing sunglasses. Behind them is a mountain view and blue sky. Overall, they are probably a group of friends enjoyin their vacation by hiking together.

subQuestions.title: When was the last time you went somewhere with your friends?
subQuestions.suggestion: The last time I hung out with my friends was last weekend. It was my friend’s birthday. We celebrated it at a restaurant.The restaurant is not a luxurious place, but they are spotless and there are many plants there since my friends love nature. We decided to have a three-course meal there and then went to a local pub to get some drinks. It was a fun and memorable experience.

subQuestions.title: Why do people enjoy doing things together?
subQuestions.suggestion: People enjoy doing things together because it is a time to socialize, to share stories and laugh together. It also strengthens our bonds, enabling us to understand each other better.

content.questionName: Speaking - Thứ mà bạn muốn nhưng không có được - Part 2

subQuestions.title: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestions.suggestion:
• Điểm giống: Both pictures show eating places.

Cả hai bức ảnh đều thể hiện được những nơi ăn uống

  • Điểm khác: In picture 1, a girl is carrying food. She must be a waitress. The impression is the girl's radiant smile. I don't feel tired when doing this job, but very happy and comfortable. Certainly attracts a lot of customers. I guess this is a low restaurant.

In picture 2, the girl wears a serving outfit, comes to the customer's table and thoughtfully takes the order, with a respectful, considerate, warm attitude towards the customer. The space of the restaurant looks so sophisticated and luxurious. I guess this is a high quality restaurant.

Trong hình 1, một cô gái đang mang thức ăn. Cô ấy chắc hẳn là một cô hầu bàn. Ấn tượng là nụ cười rạng rỡ của cô gái. Tôi không cảm thấy mệt mỏi khi làm công việc này mà rất vui vẻ và thoải mái. Chắc chắn sẽ thu hút được rất nhiều khách hàng. Tôi đoán đây là một nhà hàng thấp.

Ở hình 2, cô gái mặc trang phục phục vụ, đến bàn khách và chu đáo nhận món, với thái độ tôn trọng, ân cần, niềm nở với khách. Không gian của nhà hàng nhìn rất tinh tế và sang trọng. Tôi đoán đây là một nhà hàng chất lượng cao.

subQuestions.title: What are the attractions of eating in these different places?
subQuestions.suggestion:
• Each place will have its own attractions.
  • Eating in a low restaurant, the food is cheap suitable for many people, you can eat more food, without having to pay attention to the same rules as in luxury restaurants.
  • Eating in a high restaurant, expressing elegance, politeness, beautifully decorated space, and on-site service. However, the food is expensive.

Each place has its own attractions. When people are eating in a low restaurant, the waiter will give them a menu, paper, and a pen to write down what to order. They will have more time to order and feel more comfortable. The food is suitable for many people, you can eat more food, without having to pay attention to the same rules as in luxury restaurants. When people are eating in a high restaurant, the waiter comes to the table to take down the customer’s order. That is the feeling that “the customer is king”. The restaurant is decorated beautifully and luxurious.

Mỗi nơi đều có những điểm hấp dẫn riêng. Khi mọi người dùng bữa ở một nhà hàng nhỏ, người phục vụ sẽ đưa cho họ thực đơn, giấy và bút để viết món cần gọi. Khách hàng sẽ có nhiều thời gian hơn để đặt hàng và cảm thấy thoải mái hơn. Món ăn phù hợp với nhiều người, bạn có thể ăn nhiều đồ ăn hơn mà không cần phải chú ý đến những quy tắc giống như ở những nhà hàng sang trọng. Khi mọi người đang dùng bữa trong một nhà hàng cao cấp, người phục vụ sẽ đến bàn ghi món ăn của khách hàng. Đó chính là cảm giác “khách hàng là thượng đế”. Nhà hàng được trang trí đẹp mắt và sang trọng.

subQuestions.title: Why do some people like to eat out on special occasions?
subQuestions.suggestion:
• Create precious memories, express luxury, politeness.
  • People are too lazy to do groceries or wash dishes after meals so, eating out is much more convenient.
  • People want to change of atmosphere.

Some people like to eat out on the special occasions.Because create precious memories, express luxury, politeness, people lazy to do groceries or wash dishes after meals so, eating out is much more convenient, for a change of atmosphere, eating out bring about new experience than at home.

Một số người thích đi ăn ngoài vào những dịp đặc biệt. Vì tạo ra những kỷ niệm quý giá, thể hiện sự sang trọng, lịch sự nên người ta lười đi chợ hay rửa bát sau bữa ăn nên việc đi ăn ngoài sẽ thuận tiện hơn nhiều, để thay đổi không khí, đi ăn ngoài mang lại cảm giác mới mẻ. trải nghiệm hơn ở nhà.

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture
subQuestions.suggestion:
In the picture is a group of 7 people in a very nice room. There was a man dressed very neatly standing and speaking in front of people. This man's demeanor is very calm and confident. There are many papers and files on the table. I guess they were presenting about some important project.

I remember I used to be like that before. I am also very confident speaking in front of people.

Trong hình là một nhóm gồm 7 người trong một căn phòng rất đẹp. Có một người đàn ông đang mặc rất chỉnh tề và đứng nói trước những người còn lại. Phong thái của người đàn ông này rất điềm tĩnh, tự tin. Trên bàn có rất nhiều giấy tờ và hồ sơ. Tôi đoán là họ đang thuyết trình về một dự án quan trọng nào đó.

Tôi nhớ lại trước kia tôi cũng đã từng như vậy. Tôi cũng rất tự tin nói trước đám đông.

subQuestions.title: Tell me the last time you spoke in front of a lot of people.
subQuestions.suggestion:
• The last time spoke in front of a lot of people was 5 months ago.
  • When presenting initial emotions: shy, worried, scared,...Later, calm down, confident.
  • After the presentation that day, I felt like I had become a different person.

The last time I spoke in front of a lot of people was 5 months ago. When I was a leader in a group. This is the first time I have been the leader and present in front of a lot of people. First, I felt shy, worried about, and scared,.. because many people follow me and they were evaluating my actions when I spoke. Later, I was calm down and confident,...because I was preparing it very carefully. I spoke smoothly, about how to emphasize important points. Finally, the presentation was successful and many people complimented me. After the presentation that day, I became more confident, bolder and transformed myself into a different person to be more successful.

Lần cuối cùng tôi nói trước nhiều người là vào 5 tháng trước. Khi ấy tôi là trưởng nhóm. Đây là lần đầu tiên tôi trong vai trò lãnh đạo và thuyết trình trước mọi người. Ban đầu, tôi cảm thấy ngại, sợ, lo lắng,.. bởi vì có rất nhiều người theo dõi và đánh giá những hành động khi tôi nói. Về sau, tôi cảm thấy bình tĩnh, tự tin,.. bởi vì tôi đã chuẩn bị nos cẩn thận. Tôi nói rất mượt, biết nhấn nhá những điểm quan trọng. Cuối cùng, bài thuyết trình diễn ra tốt đẹp và nhiều người đã dành lời khen cho tôi. Sau buổi nói ngày hôm đó tôi có thêm nhiều tự tin hơn, mạnh dạn hơn và tự biến mình thành một con người khác để thành công hơn.

subQuestions.title: Why do people usually feel worried when speaking in front of many people?
subQuestions.suggestion:
• People were afraid that they didn’t speak well, not able to say the key point problem because there were many other people following them. They were shy and might cry.
  • Some people were unconfident about appearance, voice, ethnicity. They were afraid that their bad appearance would be criticized, and teased by others.

That was obvious. Because people were afraid that they didn’t speak well, not able to say the key point problem because there were many other people following them. They were shy and might cry. Some people were unconfident about appearance, voice, ethnicity,...They were afraid that their bad appearance would be criticized, and teased by others.

Đó là một điều hiển nhiên. Bởi vì rất nhiều ánh mắt của người khác nhìn họ. Họ ngại và có thể sẽ khóc. Một số người lại tự ti về ngoại hình, giọng nói, dân tộc,... Họ sợ rằng ngoại hình xấu sẽ bị mọi người chỉ trích và trêu ghẹo,...

subQuestions.title: Tell me what you see in the two photographs?

He is sitting on a beige couch and is reading a book, while also holding a cup of coffee.He looks so chilled and relaxed, but also really concentrated. I like this picture because I also enjoy reading books very much.
  • In the second picture, I can see a little boy sitting in front of the computer screen. He is wearing headphones and is probably using switches to play the video game shown on the computer screen. I can not see his face but I think he enjoys it very much.

subQuestions.title: How do you schedule your day to include focused studying and entertainment breaks?
subQuestions.suggestion: • I often use the Pomodoro technique, which is a great tool to help me focus better when studying. This is a structured series of shorter periods of focus that builds in time for your brain to take a break. For example, I will work hard on my academic workloads for 45 minutes and then have a 10-minute short break. This not only motivates me to focus on my study but also provides me the well-deserved break to entertain myself. This method keeps stress at bay and makes my study process more pleasant and enjoyable.

subQuestions.title: Playing video games is not for adults. What do you think?
subQuestions.suggestion: • I respectfully disagree with this. Video games can be enjoyed by people of all ages, including adults. Many adults find video games to be a fun and engaging form of entertainment, and they can even provide stress relief and cognitive stimulation. It's all about personal preference and finding activities that bring joy and fulfillment. However, one should not spend too much time on video games, they should play in moderation.

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture.
subQuestions.suggestion: • Looking at the picture, I can see three people: a man, a woman and a child. They must be a small family. The father has curly hair and is wearing a navy sweater, while the mother is wearing a scarf on her head with white sweater and jeans. The man is sitting on the sofa and is working on his laptop, looking very attentive, while the woman is lying on the sofa, embracing her sleeping child. The sofa is plain gray, with a beige and an orange pillow. They look so peaceful together and the room is cozy. I like this picture because it reminds me of an ideal family.

subQuestions.title: Tell me the last time you worked when others slept.
subQuestions.suggestion: • The other night, I had a tight deadline for a project due the next morning. My mother, exhausted from a long day, had fallen asleep early. So I had to tiptoe into my home office and open my computer screen. While my mother was peacefully asleep in the next room, I dove into my work. As the night wore on, my eyelids grew heavy, but I pressed on, because of the urgency of the deadline. However, I was so nervous that typing the keyboard might wake my mom up in the middle of the night. Finally, just as the first light of dawn began to peek through the curtains, I put the finishing touches on my project. With a sigh of relief, I quietly shut down my computer and tiptoed back to my room, careful not to wake my sleeping mother. As I crawled into bed, I couldn't help but feel proud of my dedication and the beautiful work I had accomplished, all while my mother slept peacefully.

subQuestions.title: The older we get, the more responsibility we have. Do you agree?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Yes, as we grow older, we often encounter new roles and challenges in our personal and professional lives. These can include career advancements, starting families, managing finances, and contributing to our communities. With each milestone, there's often an increase in responsibilities, and we need to face them responsibly so that we can gain greater roles and achievements in life.

subQuestions.title: Does technology affect the way we read books?
subQuestions.suggestion:

  • Social media has reduced readership in our daily life, making people less interested in reading books.

I think he is sleeping in the living room. Overall, this picture brings me a feeling of peace and loneliness.

subQuestions.title: The last time you went somewhere in a car?
subQuestions.suggestion: I would like to describe quite a long but exciting journey that I went on last week by car from my hometown to Hanoi. I had three travelling companions in the car with me, who were three of my close friends and we had agreed on gathering at my house at 5am, which was our point of departure. Luckily, the weather that day was really nice, so we were able to leave the windows down for most of the trip. The fresh air and tranquillity of the countryside made me feel really relaxed but energetic at the same time.

subQuestions.title: Is it It is important for people to learn to drive ? Why ?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Yes. Because learning to drive not only will driving improve your social life, but it'll also significantly improve your day-to-day life. Whether it's school, work or running errands, having a car makes everything easier and will save you time. In some cases, driving can be safer than using public transportation, especially if you are traveling alone or at night.

subQuestions.title: Tell me what you see in two the pictures.
subQuestions.suggestion:
• Giống: Both pictures show places to eat/eating places. 
  • Khác:

In the first picture,...

But in the second picture,...

Regarding the differences, in the first picture, it is a popular restaurant/ a low-cost restaurant, in contrast, in the second picture, it is a high-class restaurant. 

  • Thích tranh nào hơn: I prefer picture 2 because I always have money to burn. 

Cả hai hình ảnh hiển thị những địa điểm ăn uống.

Trong bức tranh đầu tiên,...

Nhưng ở bức tranh thứ hai,...

Về sự khác biệt, ở hình 1 là quán bình dân/ bình dân, ngược lại ở hình 2 là nhà hàng cao cấp.

Tôi thích hình 2 hơn vì tôi luôn có tiền để đốt, tiêu xài.

subQuestions.title: What would it be like to eat in two places?
subQuestions.suggestion:
In a low-cost restaurant, we are offered a more budget-friendly and casual dining experience. The first place (pic 1) often has simpler menus. It means the dish may be basic and familiar. In addition, the atmosphere is designed to cater to a wide range of customers.

In a high-class restaurant, we can expect a more luxurious dining experience with a strong emphasis on quality and service. It offers a diverse and sophisticated menu and dishes are beautifully presented. The chefs need to focus on using high-quality ingredients and innovative cooking techniques. Service in a high-class restaurant is top-notch and often has staff members attending to customers’ needs. 

Trong một nhà hàng bình dân, chúng ta được cung cấp trải nghiệm ăn uống bình dân và hợp túi tiền hơn. Địa điểm đầu tiên  (ảnh 1) thường có menu đơn giản hơn. Có nghĩa là món ăn có thể cơ bản và quen thuộc. Ngoài ra, không khí nhà hàng được thiết kế để phục vụ cho nhiều đối tượng khách hàng.

Trong một nhà hàng cao cấp, chúng ta có thể mong đợi một trải nghiệm ăn uống sang trọng hơn với sự tập trung về chất lượng và dịch vụ. Nó cung cấp một thực đơn đa dạng và tinh tế, các món ăn được trình bày đẹp mắt. Các đầu bếp cần tập trung vào việc sử dụng nguyên liệu chất lượng cao và kỹ thuật nấu ăn độc đáo sáng tạo. Dịch vụ trong một nhà hàng cao cấp là hàng đầu và thường có nhân viên phục vụ nhu cầu của khách hàng.

subQuestions.title: Which of the two places would be healthier to eat in? Why?
subQuestions.suggestion:
It depends on a variety of factors including cooking methods, ingredients used, and menu options. However, high-class restaurants often prioritize quality ingredients and more diverse options. Portions there are typically smaller which can help control the amount of food we eat. 

Điều đó phụ thuộc vào nhiều yếu tố bao gồm phương pháp nấu ăn, nguyên liệu được sử dụng và các lựa chọn trong thực đơn. Tuy nhiên, nhà hàng cao cấp thường ưu tiên nguyên liệu chất lượng và lựa chọn đa dạng hơn. Các phần ăn thường nhỏ hơn có thể giúp kiểm soát lượng thức ăn chúng ta ăn.

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture
subQuestions.suggestion: • There are several people in the picture, it looks like they are in a cinema. Some people are having a cup of soda, popcorns to enjoy the movie. They are creasing up together, it may well be that the movie they are watching is a comedy.

subQuestions.title: Tell me a time you laughed a lot
subQuestions.suggestion:
A time I laughed a lot was when I visited my best friend’s house. She lived with her family and they invited me to stay for dinner. We told funny stories during the meal and laughed a lot. After dinner, we went out to watch the latest movie at that time which was named: “Transformers”. The film was wonderful and we were all satisfied with the ending. 

Một lần tôi đã cười rất nhiều là khi tôi đến thăm nhà người bạn thân nhất của mình. Cô ấy sống với gia đình cô ấy và họ mời tôi ở lại ăn tối. Chúng tôi kể chuyện vui trong bữa ăn và cười rất nhiều. Sau bữa tối, chúng tôi ra ngoài xem bộ phim mới nhất lúc bấy giờ có tên là: “Transformers”. Bộ phim thật tuyệt vời và tất cả chúng tôi đều hài lòng với cái kết.

subQuestions.title: Do you think people from different countries laugh at different things?
subQuestions.suggestion:
Yes. People from different countries laugh at different things, I guess. I think it depends on cultural and social situations.

Normally, people laugh when they feel happy or see something funny, or when playing jokes.

In Japanese communication/conversations often involve a high level of respect, especially in professional cases. In such contexts, laughter might be seen as not suitable/ inappropriate. 

Đúng. Tôi đoán mọi người từ các quốc gia khác nhau cười vì những điều khác nhau. Tôi nghĩ rằng nó phụ thuộc vào các tình huống văn hóa và xã hội.

Thông thường, mọi người cười khi họ cảm thấy hạnh phúc hoặc thấy điều gì đó hài hước, hoặc khi đùa giỡn.

Trong giao tiếp/cuộc trò chuyện của người Nhật thường liên quan đến mức độ tôn trọng cao, đặc biệt là trong các trường hợp chuyên nghiệp. Trong những bối cảnh như vậy, cười lớn có thể bị coi là không phù hợp.

subQuestions.title: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestions.suggestion:
• In the first picture, there is a man eating a whole table of food in the kitchen. He is wearing a red hoodie and holding a glass of coke and a crossant by both hands. He is gobbling up fast food and he seems to enjoy them so much. On the table, there are many dishes, namely cake, pizza, ice-cream, hamburger, and so on. Behind him are kitchen furniture with many cooking utensils hung on the wall.
  • In the second picture, I can see a man cooking in his kitchen. He is wearing a grey sweater and a brown apron in order not to blot his clothes. On the table, there are many cooking ingredients, most of them are vegetables, such as brocoli, bell pepers, tomatoes and carrots, and cooking oil. The man is adding spices into a pot, which is placed on a stove. He looks so concentrated, but he is definitely enjoying the cooking process. I like this picture because I am also keen on making meals for my family.

subQuestions.title: Which kind of food in those pictures is healthier?
subQuestions.suggestion: It would definitely be vegetables. Fruit and vegetables are a good source of vitamins and minerals, including vitamin C and other nutrients. They're an excellent source of dietary fibre, which can help to maintain a healthy gut and prevent digestion problems. A diet high in fibre can also reduce your risk of bowel cancer. By contrast, fast food contains high levels of fat and oil, which are contributors to obesity and cancer.

subQuestions.title: What are the benefits of them?
subQuestions.suggestion:
Fruit and vegetables are a good source of vitamins and minerals, including vitamin C and other nutrients. They're an excellent source of dietary fibre, which can help to maintain a healthy gut and prevent digestion problems. A diet high in fibre can also 

reduce your risk of bowel cancer.

content.questionName: Speaking -   BAO QUANH BỞI THIÊN NHIÊN - Part 3

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture.
subQuestions.suggestion: In the picture, I can see two women talking with each other. They must be best friends. The woman on the left has fair skin, and is wearing a red stripped shirt and blue jeans, while her friend, who is the woman on the right has brighter skin and she is wearing a light blue shirt and blue jeans. Both have long black hair, which is beautiful of them. They are sitting on a light green sofa with their legs crossed and holding yellow cups of hot coffee, maybe. They seem to be having a fun and interesting conversation together. I like this picture because it depicts perfectly how my friend and I often catch up with each other.

subQuestions.title: Tell me about the last time you had a heart-to-heart conversation with someone.
subQuestions.suggestion: The last meaningful conversation I had was with my friend, I was put in a position that if I didn’t do something, she would end her life as she has been suffering from depression for quite a long time. So I talked to her, I told her how important she is and how life would never be the same without her. We had a deep talk about the value of life and how to stay strong and combat difficulties when they encounter you. It was a meaningful talk with advice and genuine feelings that brought me so many life lessons and how to sympathize with others’ struggles. I appreciate any opportunity to have such conversation with my family and friends, especially when it helps us to express our feelings and be able to understand others’ situations.

subQuestions.title: Talking is the best way to solve problems. Do you agree with this opinion?
subQuestions.suggestion: I agree that most problems can be solved by talking when two or more parties are in agreement to work toward a resolution. Talking to people about things that upset you can be great. It can make you feel understood and give you good perspectives. By being sympathized and given good advice, you will be encouraged and empowered to come up with solutions to your own problems. Dealing with difficulties alone may dishearten you, but if you are able to share your struggles with someone, it would be much easier.

content.questionName: Speaking -   BAO QUANH BỞI THIÊN NHIÊN - Part 2

subQuestions.title: Compare 2 pictures
subQuestions.suggestion:
giống: Both pictures describe sports activities in competition.

khác:

  • In the first picture, there are two football teams playing against each other for a championship. They are the red team and white team. The footballer from the white team is jumping and kicking the ball, while other players are chasing after him in order to get the ball from him. The match looks really interesting and dramatic, since both teams want to win this match. Behind them is the audience.
  • In the second picture, I can see a man pole-vaulting. He is wearing an orange tank top and sporty black shorts, with trainers. He is very muscular. He looks concentrated and determinded to jump over the pole. Behind him is the blue sky. I like this picture because it captures a very beautiful image of a pole-vault athlete.

subQuestions.title: The attractions of these different kinds of sport?
subQuestions.suggestion: • People prefer football over any kinds of sports because of the animating atmosphere it brings back. They go wild when our team wins a game- they even drive around waving flags and honking. Also, pole-vault is attractive because it helps improve the function of joints.

subQuestions.title: Why are sports more popular than others?

content.questionName: Speaking - Xem tác phẩm nghệ thuật - Part 3

subQuestions.title: Describe this picture?
subQuestions.suggestion: Looking at the picture, I can see four people, including: a man and a woman with 2 children. They look like a nuclear family. The mother is wearing a white top and pants, while the father is wearing a blue shirt and beige cargo pants. The little girl looks so adorable with a white dress and braids.  The father and mother are sitting together on the sofa, while their two kids are playing with their tablet happily. It looks like they are in the living room, behind the sofa is a big window, decorated with brown and white curtains. I like this picture because it reminds me of happy memories I have with my family.

subQuestions.title: Your experience of using a computer.
subQuestions.suggestion: • I’ve been working with computers for the past 6 years. MS Word, MS Excel, and MS PowerPoint helped me a lot while working on various seminary projects and essays at school. Obviously I also enjoy watching movies and stuff in my free time, and I believe it isn’t a complete waste of time, since you also learn to work with other software programs, installing necessary drivers and overall it isn’t just as simple as hitting a button and watching a movie you want to watch. I can honestly say that I do not find it hard working with computers, and look forward to using them in my new job.

subQuestions.title: Do you think technology makes life eassier ?
subQuestions.suggestion: Technology makes life easier by automating tasks, reducing manual efforts, and enhancing efficiency. For example, household appliances like washing machines and dishwashers save time and effort in cleaning chores.

content.questionName: Speaking - Xem tác phẩm nghệ thuật - Part 2

subQuestions.title: Describe the two pictures.
What are the differences between life in the countryside and in the city?
subQuestions.suggestion:
(Sự khác biệt giữa cuộc sống ở nông thôn và thành phố là gì?)

  • There are various differences between life in the countryside and in the city. First, in the countryside, there is more open space and cleaner air and less noise. There, the living cost is lower than that in the city but there are fewer services like restaurants or food ordering apps. In contrast, the city has more job opportunities and more noise. 

Có nhiều sự khác biệt giữa cuộc sống ở nông thôn và thành phố. Thứ nhất, ở nông thôn có nhiều không gian thoáng đãng, không khí trong lành hơn và ít tiếng ồn hơn. Ở đó, chi phí sinh hoạt thấp hơn ở thành phố nhưng có ít dịch vụ hơn như nhà hàng hay ứng dụng đặt đồ ăn. Ngược lại, thành phố có nhiều cơ hội việc làm hơn và nhiều tiếng ồn hơn.

  • You need to consider the pros and cons before choosing the place to live. 

Bạn cần cân nhắc những ưu và nhược điểm trước khi lựa chọn nơi sinh sống.

subQuestions.title: Do you prefer living in the countryside or living in the city?
subQuestions.suggestion:
(Bạn thích sống ở nông thôn hay sống ở thành phố?)

  • For me, I like both of those places. Why do I have to choose? To be more convenient for my work and study, I still live in the cities. On holidays or weekends, I go back to the countryside - my hometown to unwind. Coming back to my home helps me recharge my energy for the upcoming week.

Đối với tôi, tôi thích cả hai nơi đó. Tại sao tôi phải lựa chọn? Để thuận tiện hơn cho công việc và học tập, tôi vẫn sống ở thành phố. Vào những ngày nghỉ lễ hoặc cuối tuần, tôi lại về quê - quê hương của mình để thư giãn. Trở về nhà giúp tôi nạp lại năng lượng cho tuần sắp tới.

content.questionName: Speaking - GIẢI QUYẾT MỘT VẤN ĐỀ - Part 3

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture.
How difficult is it for young people to learn to cook these days?
subQuestions.suggestion:
(Giới trẻ ngày nay khó khăn như thế nào trong việc học nấu ăn?)

  • Yes, I agree that it is difficult for young people to learn how to cook these days. First, you know what, many young people like me are very busy with work, study and other activities, which makes finding time to cook meals so hard. Second, it is so convenient to order delicious dishes on some apps like Shopee Food, Beamin and so on. Finally, young people enjoy being served food at restaurants. 


 Đúng, tôi đồng ý rằng giới trẻ ngày nay học nấu ăn rất khó. Đầu tiên, bạn biết không, nhiều người trẻ như tôi rất bận rộn với công việc, học tập và các hoạt động khác nên việc tìm thời gian để nấu bữa ăn trở nên khó khăn. Thứ hai, thật tiện lợi khi đặt những món ăn ngon trên một số ứng dụng như Shopee Food, Beamin, v.v. Cuối cùng, giới trẻ thích được phục vụ đồ ăn tại nhà hàng.

subQuestions.title: When was the last time you went out to eat?
subQuestions.suggestion:
• Ok. Let me remember. The last time I went out to eat was on one of my friends’ birthday. I was invited to come and join her party. I bought an expensive handbag from LV for her. 


On that day, after I came home from work, I took a shower and got dressed to be beautiful then I went to her house. Everything was ready. After the party, I went home and read some books. Finally, I went to bed and called my boyfriend. (phát triển từ “Làm gì trong 1 ngày: ra nè, dễ không)

 Được rồi. Hãy để tôi nhớ lại. Lần cuối cùng tôi đi ăn là vào ngày sinh nhật của một người bạn. Tôi được mời đến và tham gia bữa tiệc của cô ấy. Tôi đã mua cho cô ấy một chiếc túi xách đắt tiền từ hãng LV.

Hôm đó, sau khi đi làm về, tôi tắm rửa, thay đồ thật đẹp rồi sang nhà cô ấy. Mọi thứ đã sẵn sàng. Sau bữa tiệc, tôi về nhà và đọc vài cuốn sách. Cuối cùng, tôi đi ngủ và gọi điện cho bạn trai.

content.questionName: Speaking - GIẢI QUYẾT MỘT VẤN ĐỀ - Part 2

subQuestions.title: Describe those pictures.
subQuestions.suggestion:
(e viết so sánh tranh dự trên cấu trúc bên dưới nhé)


Cấu trúc so sánh tranh

1.Điểm giống: The two pictures show/are related to + Chủ đề chính (Common topic).

Both of them look colorful.

2.Điểm khác:

+(NGƯỜI) In the first picture, I can see... people who are (talking, eating,...). I guess they are (a family/a group of friends)...including:... They look so... in... clothes

Likewise, there is/are ... people in the second photo. I think they are ... They look very...in...clothes.

+(VẬT) The picture on the left shows ... in the background. The space/ the weather is...

By contrast, the picture on the right shows... The space/ the weather is...


3. Cảm nhận: I am impressed by the first one/ second one because it reminds me of some wonderful memories.

  •  The two pictures show people in different travel destinations. Both of them look colorful. In the first picture, I can see many people who are lying and playing on a beach. They look so comfortable in swimming clothes. Likewise, there is a woman in the second photo. She looks very cozy in her warm clothes. The picture on the left shows the sea in the background. The space/ the weather is very hot. By contrast, the picture on the right shows a lake in the winter. The space/ the weather is freezing cold. I am impressed by the first one/ second one because it reminds me of some wonderful memories.

subQuestions.title: Do you like going to crowded beaches?
subQuestions.suggestion: • No one loves going to crowded beaches. Most of the time, crowded beaches are filled with lots of trash since there are many people who are not educated about environmental protection and the management policy is not proper. Also, I love quiet beaches where I can surf and play beach games without being limited by others’ presence.

subQuestions.title: Why do many people like quiet places?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Because it's relaxing and you can get your thoughts together without any interruptions. A quiet place is something that helps us feel relaxed and comfortable, and clear our mind. Most people prefer quiet places whenever they feel low. They prefer to stay alone for some time, to get a peaceful mind and improve concentration

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture.
subQuestions.suggestion:
(e viết mô tả dựa trên cấu trúc này nhé)


NGƯỜI:

1. (Số lượng + hành động) In the foreground, I can see... people who are (talking, eating,...). I guess they are (a family/a group of friends)...including:...

2. (Ngoại hình) They look professional in formal clothes./ They look so comfortable in casual clothes. Plus, they seem to be very excited.

VẬT:

1. (Cảnh vật) I think they are in (a kitchen, a classroom,...). The space is large/narrow. The weather is nice.

2. (Đồ vật) In the picture, I can see some interesting things:...,...,...

NẾU VẪN CHƯA HẾT THỜI GIAN: I love this picture at first sight because it reminds me of some wonderful moments with my family/ my friends.

  • I can see two people who are talking. I guess they are friends, including two men, with one wearing a yellow T-shirt and the other wearing a grey sweater. They look so comfortable in casual clothes. Plus, they seem to be very excited. I think they are in a clothing shop. The space is large. In the picture, I can see some interesting things: some vintage handbags, pairs of sneakers, and long-sleeved shirts.I love this picture at first sight because it reminds me of some wonderful moments with my friends.

subQuestions.title: Tell me about a time you went shopping with your friend.
subQuestions.suggestion: • I once went shopping with my best friend in a mall in the city centre. At first, we intended to buy some dresses for our next vacation, but then my friend and I decided to spend another hour at a thrift store together. Even though we spent a large sum of money on clothes, that was a fun and memorable experience that I would love to do with her in the future.

subQuestions.title: Some people are not interested in online shopping. How about you?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Personally, I love shopping online for various reasons. Online shopping can provide great convenience. You can access your online store anytime, anywhere and order it online and get it delivered to your home, without going to a physical store while still saving your money on gas and time. Most of the time shopping online offers cheaper prices because online shoppers do not need to pay the rent of an estate.

subQuestions.title: Describe 2 the pictures.
What difficulties do you encounter when studying at the library or coffee shop?
subQuestions.suggestion:
• When studying at the library, people are expected to keep silent so I find it inconvenient when I need to ask for my friends’ help to solve a task.
  • Regarding the coffee shop, it can be too noisy sometimes as there are other people around chatting together.

subQuestions.title: Which place do you prefer? Why?
subQuestions.suggestion: I prefer to study in a coffee shop because I feel motivated when having a drink while doing homework. About the noisy environment, I think I can deal with it by having my earphones on.

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture.
subQuestions.suggestion: Looking at the picture, I can see a family having a meal together. There are four people in this family, a father, a mother and their 2 children. The mom is serving the meal while looking at her child endearingly. There are a lot of well-prepared dishes on the table.

subQuestions.title: Why do people enjoy eating together?
subQuestions.suggestion:
• People like to eat together because they don't feel lonely, they have someone to talk to, to share secret stories, to share their joys and sorrows. Eating together will make more connection and understanding. Maybe it's due to being too lazy to cook at home or eat out to change the atmosphere

Người ta thích đi ăn cùng nhau vì không cảm thấy cô đơn, có người để tâm sự, tâm sự những chuyện thầm kín, chia sẻ niềm vui nỗi buồn. Ăn cùng nhau sẽ tạo nên sự kết nối và hiểu biết nhiều hơn. Có lẽ do lười nấu ăn ở nhà hoặc đi ăn ngoài để thay đổi không khí

subQuestions.title: Young people are too busy to cook for their families?
subQuestions.suggestion:
• Correct
  • Nowadays people focus on work but forget the small values and forget about family.
  • They go to work every day every night. A meal can sometimes be fast food or purchased from a store. That's sad.

Đúng. Ngày nay con người chuyên tâm vào công việc mà quên mất những giá trị nhỏ bé, quên đi gia đình. Họ đi làm tối ngày. Một bữa ăn có khi là đồ ăn nhanh hay mua sẵn ngoài cửa hàng. Thật đáng buồn.

subQuestions.title: Compare 2 pictures
subQuestions.suggestion:
• In the first picture, there is an old man having his meal all alone. The old man looks 50-60 years old. He has grey hair, and he is wearing eyeglasses and a beige sweater. He is having lunch by himself. On the dining table, there are three dishes, most of them are made from vegetables, and a glass of water. I think this is a healthy diet and suitable for elderly people. However, the old man looks a bit sad and lonely. Behind him, there is a window with sunshines and green trees.
  • In the second picture, there is a family of three people, including a father, a mother and a lovely daughter. They are having a meal at a restaurant. The father is wearing a navy T-shirt, while the mother is wearing a pastel pink shirt. The father is holding the camera. They are all smiling happily together. On the table there are three big-sized pizzas. They look so delicous.

subQuestions.title: Which two kinds of food would you prefer, and why ?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Even though vegetables are good for health, I love pizza and fast foods not only because they are delicous but also they are convenient. While you have to cook vegies in order to eat them, you just need to order a pizza, which is quick and effortless. However, such fast food should only be eaten in moderation.

subQuestions.title: Why is it  important to eat different food ?
subQuestions.suggestion: • Eating a variety of foods from the 5 major food groups provides a range of nutrients to the body, promotes good health and can help reduce the risk of disease - as well as keeping your diet interesting with different flavours and textures.

content.questionName: Speaking - Thể thao mạo hiểm - Part 3

subQuestions.title: Describe this picture?
subQuestions.suggestion: • In the picture, I can see a young woman going shopping at a grocery store. She has long black hair and is wearing a white shirt. She looks so beautiful with a happy smile on her face. She is pulling a shopping cart full of fruits and vegetables, such as: bananas, pinapples, oranges, bell pepers, …She is also checking her shopping list with a pen. On the left of the picture, there is an aisle that sells packed vegetables. Behind her, there is also a stall filled with green vegetables. I think she loves eating vegies since they are good for health.

subQuestions.title: The last time you went to a small shop?
Why is shopping on the internet so popular ?

subQuestions.title: What are the attractions of keeping these animals as pets?
subQuestions.suggestion: The allure of keeping pets is multifaceted. They offer companionship, combating loneliness and providing a sense of belonging. Studies even show they can lower stress and anxiety. Pets shower us with unwavering loyalty and affection, their greetings really make our day. Their playful personalities and antics entertain us, bringing laughter and joy. Caring for a pet creates a sense of purpose and routine, teaching responsibility and empathy, especially valuable for children and older adults. Pets can even connect us with nature, fostering a love for the natural world. Overall, the human-animal bond is powerful, enriching our lives in countless ways.

subQuestions.title: Some say animals should not be kept in the home. What do you think?
subQuestions.suggestion: I don’t agree that animals should not be kept in the home. Owning certain domesticated animals can bring wonderful benefits to both the pet and the people living in the home. Pets can offer companionship, combating loneliness and providing a sense of belonging. Studies even suggest they can improve our physical and mental health by lowering stress and encouraging exercise. Caring for a pet fosters responsibility and empathy, especially valuable for children, while also creating a routine that brings a sense of purpose. Most importantly, these advantages apply to animals well-suited for domestic life. For wild animals, a home environment can be far from ideal, so it's vital to always research an animal's specific needs before welcoming them into your life.

subQuestions.title: Why do children spend time playing?
subQuestions.suggestion: Play is essential for children's development. It's their way of learning, exploring concepts and practicing skills through building, pretending, or any activity that sparks their curiosity. This play not only fuels cognitive growth and physical development but also fosters social skills like sharing and cooperation. Additionally, play provides a much-needed outlet for relaxation and enjoyment, contributing to a child's overall well-being.

But in the second picture,…

* THÍCH BỨC TRANH NÀO HƠN: I prefer picture 1 or 2 because ….

subQuestions.title: Do you prefer living alone or living with your family?
subQuestions.suggestion:
+ Living with family:

- Living with my family is so comfortable cause I don’t need to care too much about electricity bills, water bills and living costs (tiền nhà). My mom cooks for me.

- Living with my family makes me feel like the luckiest person in the world. Every member shares with me a lot about work and life. I am always supported when I need someone besides me.

+ Living alone:

- Living alone makes me feel like I am leading an independent life. I have to work as hard as I can to be rich/ buy everything I need/want. I must be stronger.

- Living alone, I can do anything I want, I stay up too late and chat/ text with my friends. I can go out at midnight.

Sometimes, I feel blue and alone, I want to come back home and hug my parents.

+ Sống cùng gia đình:

- Sống với gia đình tôi rất thoải mái vì tôi không cần quan tâm quá nhiều đến tiền điện, tiền nước và chi phí sinh hoạt (tiền nhà). Mẹ tôi nấu ăn cho tôi.

- Được sống cùng gia đình khiến tôi cảm thấy mình là người may mắn nhất thế giới. Mọi thành viên đều chia sẻ với tôi rất nhiều về công việc và cuộc sống. Tôi luôn được hỗ trợ khi tôi cần ai đó bên cạnh.

+ Sống độc thân:

- Sống một mình khiến tôi có cảm giác mình đang sống một cuộc sống tự lập. Tôi phải làm việc chăm chỉ nhất có thể để trở nên giàu có/ mua mọi thứ tôi cần/muốn. Tôi phải mạnh mẽ hơn.

- Sống một mình, tôi có thể làm bất cứ điều gì tôi muốn, tôi thức khuya và trò chuyện/nhắn tin với bạn bè. Tôi có thể ra ngoài lúc nửa đêm.

Đôi khi, tôi cảm thấy buồn và cô đơn, tôi muốn trở về nhà và ôm bố mẹ tôi.

subQuestions.title: Is it necessary for young people to live independently from their families?
subQuestions.suggestion:
Đọc lại câu hỏi + cụm kéo dài time + The answer is…

The answer is Yes. Living independently can be a valuable experience for personal growth. It helps people learn important skills like finance management, time management,…

Although living with family may be beneficial for young people’s mental and emotional well-being, they need to know how to take care of themselves because in the future, they will be parents.

Câu trả lời là Có. Sống độc lập có thể là một trải nghiệm quý giá cho sự phát triển cá nhân. Nó giúp mọi người học các kỹ năng quan trọng như quản lý tài chính, quản lý thời gian,…

Mặc dù sống cùng gia đình có thể có lợi cho sức khỏe tinh thần và tình cảm của những người trẻ tuổi, nhưng họ cần biết cách chăm sóc bản thân vì trong tương lai, họ sẽ làm cha mẹ.

content.questionName: Speaking - RECEIVING AN EMAIL (NHẬN ĐƯỢC EMAIL HOẶC THÔNG BÁO) - Part 3

subQuestions.title: Describe the picture.
subQuestions.suggestion:
In the picture, I see many people.

This picture is about an exhibition - a room showing/ displaying many pictures, it is so large/big with many pictures on the wall. I see many people there. They are walking and looking at the picture. They are also talking about those pictures. I am impressed by - I really like the two women standing closest to me. They are middle-aged but still beautiful. This picture reminds me of my grandmother. She likes exhibitions a lot.

Trong bức ảnh, tôi thấy nhiều người.

Bức tranh này nói về một cuộc triển lãm - một căn phòng trưng bày/trưng bày nhiều bức tranh, nó rất lớn với nhiều bức tranh trên tường. Tôi thấy nhiều người ở đó. Họ đang đi bộ và nhìn vào bức tranh. Họ cũng đang nói về những bức tranh đó. Tôi ấn tượng bởi - Tôi thực sự thích hai người phụ nữ đứng gần tôi nhất. Họ đã ở độ tuổi trung niên nhưng vẫn đẹp. Hình ảnh này làm tôi nhớ đến bà tôi. Bà rất thích triển lãm.

subQuestions.title: Tell me the last time you visited the exhibition.
subQuestions.suggestion:
The last time I visited the exhibition was last week. It was in a museum near my house. I went there with my friends. We were all excited about the pictures. The topic is “Fight for Women”. On that day, we… (cut 1 phần trong một ngày của mình, thay chủ ngữ “I” thành “we”)

Lần cuối cùng tôi đến thăm triển lãm là vào tuần trước. Nó nằm trong viện bảo tàng gần nhà tôi. Tôi đã đến đó với bạn bè của tôi. Tất cả chúng tôi đều vui mừng về những bức ảnh. Chủ đề là "Đấu tranh cho phụ nữ".

subQuestions.title: Why do people like those pictures/exhibitions?
subQuestions.suggestion:
People like exhibitions for various reasons.

First, people enjoy exhibitions because they provide a unique opportunity to learn something new, whether it’s about history, art, or outer space,…

Second, exhibitions are designed to be appealing/ attractive to stimulate all senses.

Finally, people may attend exhibitions to support their favorite artists.

Mọi người thích triển lãm vì nhiều lý do.

Đầu tiên, mọi người thích triển lãm vì chúng mang đến cơ hội duy nhất để học hỏi điều gì đó mới mẻ, cho dù đó là về lịch sử, nghệ thuật, không gian bên ngoài,…

Thứ hai, triển lãm được thiết kế hấp dẫn/hấp dẫn để kích thích mọi giác quan.

Cuối cùng, mọi người có thể tham dự các cuộc triển lãm để hỗ trợ các nghệ sĩ yêu thích của họ.

content.questionName: Speaking - RECEIVING AN EMAIL (NHẬN ĐƯỢC EMAIL HOẶC THÔNG BÁO) - Part 2

subQuestions.title: Please describe the 2 pictures
subQuestions.suggestion:
• In the first picture, there is an old man doing exercise at a gym. He looks 60-70, but he is still very active and strong. The old man is wearing a turqouise shirt,  shorts and a pair of sneakers. Behind this man, there are several work-out equipment.
  • In the second picture, there are two people, a man and a woman going hiking together in the middle of a forest. The woman is wearing a green jacket and hiking boots, while the man is wearing an orange jacket and pants. They are both wearing a bulky backpack filled with camping tools and using treking tool to help them walk better in mudy surface. The background is a forest with many green trees and bushes, which look really refreshing. Those two people look tired but happy with their journey.

subQuestions.title: How important is it to do daily exercises?
subQuestions.suggestion: •  Regular physical activity is one of the most important things you can do for your health. Being physically active can improve your brain health, help manage weight, reduce the risk of disease, strengthen bones and muscles, and improve your ability to do everyday activities.

subQuestions.title: What the difference of these two exercises ?
subQuestions.suggestion: • They are gym and hiking. When you hike, you train your body to work as it is designed. This involves lots of muscles all working in synergy, adapting to the situation as required. Gyms often lack this by exercising muscles in only one motion.

subQuestions.title: Please describe what you see in the picture
subQuestions.suggestion: • Looking at the picture, I can see a single woman sitting at the bow of a yacht. She has blonde hair and is wearing a beautiful pastel blue dress. She is sitting all alone, looking towards the blue ocean. The overall picture brings me a feeling of peace since I also love the sea.

subQuestions.title: Can you tell me the last time I went sightseeing by the beach?
subQuestions.suggestion: • It was about 3 years ago, when I had a chance to visit a beach in my hometown named Quat Lam beach. I remember walking along the coastline to capture the sight of sunset, and my family and I then hired a yacht to go sightseeing together.

subQuestions.title: Why do people dislike traveling by seaway?
subQuestions.suggestion: I believe it is because they are afraid of the unpleasant incident of getting drowned or seasick, or it is simply due to their phobia.
